While the lettering does look like a dot-matrix, it's in fact done with a special inkjet-style machine. Similar machines are used for printing expiration dates on bottles and such. Unlike a paper printer, these don't require the printable surface to be right next to the nozzles, allowing them to produce fairly legible lettering on uneven surfaces.
Biggest tell-tale between the two is that dot-matrix will have uniform, evenly spaced dots while these inkjets can skew the letters if the printing surface was not moving evenly.
